intro: Corispermum spicatum, commonly known as the spike corisperm, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Chenopodiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in tundra and coastal habitats. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds adapted for wind dispersal. Corispermum spicatum is an important component of the plant communities in its native range, contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
